intro: Jacobaeastrum spathaceum, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by a dense layer of bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Jacobaeastrum spathaceum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
